reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel many times, In fact we were married there on the beach 4 years ago. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a way to truly experience the real Puerto Rico. The deluxe rooms are huge and the private balcony is wonderful. The food served at both the pool bar and the restaurant is a great value and very well prepared . As for reading other reviews both myself and my family were not treated as gringos but welcomed by all staff who went out of their to be helpful and friendly. Sandra who was in charge of our wedding and reception was fantastic to deal with. You can't ask for nicer people and Rincon is a lovely place to vacation.
reviews.title: Our favorite hotel in Puerto Rico

reviews.text: This was my first time staying at Villa Cofresi and probably won't be my last. This was a business trip, we were attending a career fair at the University of Puerto Rico-Mayaguez. My boss and I shared one of the deluxe rooms. It was spacious to say the least and had a great view. We had two king size beds in our room. Continental breakfast was included but unfortunately we had to be out of the room for work before it was served each day, we were told they would bring a bag of food to our room but it never showed up. We were also sad that we never got to use the pool because it was only open between 10 and 7, we did not return to the hotel until 8 each night. The tiki bar was awesome, bartenders were great. Never a long wait for a drink. My coworkers enjoyed "the pirate" but it was not my thing.
reviews.title: First time at Villa Cofresi...but not the last time

likes.disliked: — lack of wireless internet in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people who worked there were incredible. The room was like walking into a dream. They were putting the logo in the pool so it wasn't ready to swim in...yet that didn't matter a single bit. There was an ocean to swim in. There was sea glass and shells to be collected every morning. The guys who worked at the bar...were so sweet. I got the tops of the coconuts each time he made someone a drink. The food was great. I cried when it was time to check out and the sweetest girl who worked there handed me a Christmas ornament that said Villa Cofresi Hotel on it. Use to live on Ramey AFB...so it was an emotional vacation in that area for me. I'd leave everything I own to live at this hotel if I could. I can't say enough great things about the service, the beautiful huge room, the balcony where we watched the sun set every single evening, the location to excellant food places as well as walking distance to the laundry mat. STAY HERE IF YOU WANT A NICE RELAXING VACATION IN A VERY CLEAN BEAUTIFUL ROOM.
reviews.title: BEST PLACE TO STAY IN RINCON

likes.disliked: — That I had to leave and go home.

reviews.title: BED BUGS
reviews.text: Sherry McKee
Yes, it is true.
reviews.title: Caution - Not a Quiet Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove from San Juan Airport directly to Rincon to start our Puerto Rico vacation. We arrived at around 12:30PM and even though it wasn't check in time, the staff was able to accommodate our situation and allowed us to check in early. Hotel Cofresi has that older hotel feel but is maintained and staffed at a high level. The hotel is located right on the beach and has a medium size pool that was kept very clean. When I was there it was staffed by a lifeguard. My room was clean and well decorated with teak type furniture. From my room balcony I had a clear view of the beach and ocean. An incredible sight at sunrise. The best part of the hotel has to be the bar, right by the beach. The bartenders/ grill cook are amazing. The night I was there, the bartenders kept providing me with cold Medella, even though the bar was packed. The bartenders were very knowledgeable of the area and even directed me to a nearby restaurant, where I had the best Chijo fish I have ever tasted. Overall the Hotel and staff were outstanding. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great Hotel to Relax and have fun!!

likes.disliked: — Finding Hotel. Need a bigger sign

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are long-time fans of this family-operated hotel (but it's more like a big home). There are many repeat guests who look forward to seeing one another year after year. The staff could not be more accommodating - any request gets their best effort. We think this place is best for an extended stay because each annual visit benefits from discovering what's that season's best feature (restaurant, site to visit, etc.). There is a personality component in the reactions to this place. If you want luxury, gambling and wearing jewels to dinner, go to San Juan -- this place is much too laid back for you. Alternatively, good safe beach, comfortable rooms (choose to fit your tastes - active bar area, pool access or remote), wide selection of local dining opportunities, convenient supermarket, free wi-fi availability and amiable clientele all contribute to the quality of your stay. All this at reasonable prices -- about the only place you detect the economizing is in the Continental breakfast, but you can save your caloric intake to indulge in a nice fish dinner (try a whole snapper, called chillo entero).
reviews.title: Like your most comfortable old shoes

reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from the Villa Cofresi after a 4 day stay. I was told to stay there by a coworker who said it was a clean, friendly, and accomodating hotel with a private beach. The hotel lived up to my expectations.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Pirate
Old dated hotel
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, places to visit, and arranging a taxi to the airport. (As a side note, I wish I had rented a car as driving is neccessary to see most of Rincon.)

reviews.title: Fabulous Customer Service, Superior Ocean View
reviews.text: The beach was small but very clean and I never had trouble getting a lounge chair. The pool was less than fatastic but who needs a pool when you have a calm, clean ocean to swim in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a long weekend at Villa, clean, nice, and relaxing. Staying by the bar could be a problem, but the room we got was away from the bar so it was just perfect. The bathroom is very small, but clean. The bar is lots of fun if your looking for a party place. The local area restaurant's had great food at a reasonable price. They are losing alot of beach, due to the storms, so their might not be too much beach left within the next couple of years. The staff were very nice and helpful. I would stay again...
reviews.title: Worth the money

reviews.text: We love the Villa Cofresi. We were married here three years ago. Recently we had the pleasure of spending an entire week at The Villa for our third anniversary. Our two year old and four month old came too. The location right on the beach and the sunsets make it special. Our two year old loved the pool. As soon as you arrive go to the bar and have a Pirata, The Villa's signature cocktail.
reviews.title: We love The Villa Cofresi, you will too!

reviews.text: We enjoy the mix of Puerto Ricans and Gringos here. Some areas of Rincon feel segregated, all Gringo or all Puerto Rican, The Villa has a nice mix. The staff was wonderful. When our infant had a fever the owner arranged for us to see a doctor and be in and out without spending the whole day which is the norm in PR.
reviews.title: Overall happy with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to go to bed early be sure to request a quiet room.
reviews.title: Great location, but noisy

reviews.text: My husband, 16 year old daughter and 16 year old niece stayed 4 nights at the Villa Cofresi after researching these boards and overall it was a great experience.
reviews.title: Definitely Returning

reviews.text: When we first arrived, it was exactly how I had imagined, nothing fancy, but nice beach location and lowkey atmosphere. We had requested a "quiet", oceanview room. The room was a nice size. At checkin they offered us a beach umbrella to hold on to for our stay, and we gladly accepted. Furnishings are a bit dated, but very clean. Minutes after arriveing in our room, they sent up a gift basket, with fruit, snacks, a t-shirt and a few other things. Needless to say, we thought this was perfect.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on a big holiday weekend in the area (Good Friday/Easter). The hotel was packed, mostly locals (judging by the large number of spanish speakers). The beach was crowded and some groups were on the loud side, with radios blasting. The beach itself though was very nice. The best time of the day with in the morning or late afternoon when it was quieter.
reviews.title: Affordable Beach Trip

reviews.text: We ate our first night (Thursday) at the hotel restaurant. It turned out to be the best food we had while in the area. It's reasonable, and the fish very fresh, I'd gladly recommend it. Breakfast on the other had was pretty awful. Wonder bread, and pre-wrapped american cheese slices, ham, fruit of the day (either apples, plums, kiwi) and some 'danish' (also, in some cases pre-wrapped). There was a toaster and goorge forman grill available. Eggs are available at an extra cost as well.
reviews.title: The right choice
Villa Cofresi: Good & bad!
reviews.text: There was some kind of entertainment at the bar that night. Even though we were in the so-called quiet area, we could still here music until around midnight. This is with windows closed and a/c on. Without live entertainment there isn't much noise at all but Saturday night there was a live band, which played until well after midnight. Needless to say we didn't sleep well. We were told we should have called to complain. They said if they get more than 2 complaints they stop the music (I don't know if this is true).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place emptied out on Easter Sunday. The beach was much more peaceful then. Our last night the a/c in our room broke completely. They couldn't fix it but gave us another room to sleep in (we left our things int he first room, just slept in the other room). The other room was more updated (flat screen TV, double sinks in bathroom, nicer linens and a few other more modern touches), but still had the dated furniture, and not as great a view. It was also closer to the bar are, so probably noisier.
reviews.title: Great quick getaway
